questions.question: What are the chemical formulas of Ho-CP and Er-CP?
What method was used for the synthesis of Ln-CPs?
What is the coordination geometry of Ln(III) ions in Ln-CPs?
questions.answer: A seven-coordination geometry, i.e., a distorted pentagonal bipyramidal geometry

questions.question: What type of magnetic behavior do Ln-CPs exhibit at low temperatures?
What is the band gap value of Ho-CP and Er-CP?
questions.answer: 3.21 eV for Ho-CP and 3.22 eV for Er-CP

questions.question: How were the photocatalytic activities of Ln-CPs tested?
questions.answer: By examining the cycloaddition of CO2 to cyclic carbonates

questions.question: What was the conversion yield achieved in the photocatalytic reaction using Ln-CPs?
Can Ln-CPs be recycled for photocatalytic reactions?
questions.answer: Yes, Ln-CPs remained stable after five consecutive cycles with almost no change in the product conversion yields

questions.question: What is the significance of the amino group in Ln-CPs for photocatalytic activity?
questions.answer: The amino group interacts strongly with CO2 molecules, enhancing the cycloaddition process and, thus, the photocatalytic activity

questions.question: What potential applications do Ln-CPs have beyond photocatalysis?
questions.answer: Ln-CPs have potential in the field of physics and the magnet industry due to their magnetic behaviors

questions.question: Are Ln-CPs stable in water?
questions.answer: No, all diffraction peaks of both Ln-CPs vanished in aqueous medium after one week

questions.question: What is the role of nBu4NBr in the photocatalytic reaction?
questions.answer: nBu4NBr acts as a co-catalyst in the cycloaddition of CO2 to cyclic carbonates

questions.question: Is the photocatalytic reaction using Ln-CPs solvent-free?
Do Ln-CPs exhibit ferromagnetic interactions at low temperatures?
Was the photocatalytic performance of Ln-CPs compared to commercial TiO2?
Do Ln-CPs exhibit luminescent properties?
Are Ln-CPs synthesized using a high-pressure method?
Can Ln-CPs be used in high-temperature applications?
questions.answer: False, as they start to decompose at temperatures between 400 °C and 600 °C

questions.question: Do Ln-CPs require the presence of light to catalyze the CO2 cycloaddition reaction?
Are Ln-CPs composed of 2D or 3D structures?
